intro: Audibertia incana var. pachystachya, commonly known as the woolly false cress, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its hairy, silver-gray leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with similar floral structures. Its adaptability to harsh environments makes it a resilient species in its native habitat.
